intro: Myostemma montana, commonly known as the mountain myostem, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pentamerous flowers with five petals. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a hairy texture. Myostemma montana is often found in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
